sentences.zh: 太史公曰：殷以前尚矣。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: The period before the Yin was already ancient.

sentences.zh: 周封五等：公，侯，伯，子，男。

translations.text: The Zhou enfeoffed five ranks: duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron.

sentences.zh: 然封伯禽、康叔於魯、衛，地各四百里，親親之義，褒有德也；

translations.text: However, enfeoffing Bo Qin and Kang Shu in Lu and Wei, each with four hundred li of land, was to honor the duty of favoring relatives and to praise those with virtue;

sentences.zh: 太公於齊，兼五侯地，尊勤勞也。

translations.text: Tai Gong in Qi received territory combining five marquises' lands, to honor diligent labor.

sentences.zh: 武王、成、康所封數百，而同姓五十五，地上不過百里，下三十里，以輔衛王室。

translations.text: King Wu, Cheng, and Kang enfeoffed several hundred, with fifty-five of the same surname, the largest not exceeding one hundred li, the smallest thirty li, to assist and protect the royal house.

sentences.zh: 管、蔡、康叔、曹、鄭，或過或損。

translations.text: Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, Zheng - some exceeded, some were reduced.

sentences.zh: 厲、幽之後，王室缺，侯伯彊國興焉，天子微，弗能正。

translations.text: After Li and You, the royal house declined, powerful states of marquises and earls arose, the Son of Heaven grew weak and could not correct them.

sentences.zh: 非德不純，形勢弱也。

translations.text: It was not that virtue was not pure, but that the situation was weak.

The Grand Historian says: The period before the Yin was already ancient. The Zhou enfeoffed five ranks: duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron. However, enfeoffing Bo Qin and Kang Shu in Lu and Wei, each with four hundred li of land, was to honor the duty of favoring relatives and to praise those with virtue; Tai Gong in Qi received territory combining five marquises' lands, to honor diligent labor. King Wu, Cheng, and Kang enfeoffed several hundred, with fifty-five of the same surname, the largest not exceeding one hundred li, the smallest thirty li, to assist and protect the royal house. Guan, Cai, Kang Shu, Cao, Zheng - some exceeded, some were reduced. After Li and You, the royal house declined, powerful states of marquises and earls arose, the Son of Heaven grew weak and could not correct them. It was not that virtue was not pure, but that the situation was weak.

sentences.zh: 漢興，序二等。

translations.text: When Han arose, they established two ranks.

sentences.zh: 高祖末年，非劉氏而王者，若無功上所不置而侯者，天下共誅之。

translations.text: In the late years of Gaozu, those not of the Liu clan who became kings, or those without merit whom the emperor did not establish as marquises, were to be executed by all under heaven.

sentences.zh: 高祖子弟同姓為王者九國，雖獨長沙異姓，而功臣侯者百有餘人。

translations.text: Gaozu's sons and younger brothers of the same clan who became kings numbered nine states, although Changsha alone was of a different surname, while meritorious officials who became marquises numbered more than one hundred.

sentences.zh: 自雁門、太原以東至遼陽，為燕代國；

translations.text: From Yanmen and Taiyuan eastward to Liaoyang was the Yan and Dai states;

sentences.zh: 常山以南，大行左轉，度河、濟，阿、甄以東薄海，為齊、趙國；

translations.text: South of Changshan, turning left at Mount Taihang, crossing the Yellow River and Ji, eastward from A and Zhen to the sea, was the Qi and Zhao states;

sentences.zh: 自陳以西，南至九疑，東帶江、淮、谷、泗，薄會稽，為梁、楚、淮南、長沙國：皆外接於胡、越。

translations.text: From Chen westward, south to Jiuyi, eastward along the Yangtze, Huai, Gu, and Si rivers to Kuaiji, was the Liang, Chu, Huainan, and Changsha states: all bordering externally on the Xiongnu and Yue.

sentences.zh: 而內地北距山以東盡諸侯地，大者或五六郡，連城數十，置百官宮觀，僭於天子。

translations.text: The inner lands north of the mountains eastward encompassed all the feudal lords' territories, the largest comprising five or six commanderies, connecting dozens of cities, establishing the hundred officials and palaces, rivaling the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 漢獨有三河、東郡、潁川、南陽，自江陵以西至蜀，北自雲中至隴西，與內史凡十五郡，而公主列侯頗食邑其中。

translations.text: Han alone possessed Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, and Nanyang commanderies, from Jiangling westward to Shu, north from Yunzhong to Longxi, together with the Interior Commandery making fifteen commanderies, while princesses and marquises had their fiefs scattered among them.

sentences.zh: 何者？

translations.text: Why was this?

sentences.zh: 天下初定，骨肉同姓少，故廣彊庶孽，以鎮撫四海，用承衛天子也。

translations.text: When the realm was first pacified, flesh and blood of the same surname were few, therefore they extensively strengthened collateral branches to soothe and control the four seas, using them to support and protect the Son of Heaven.

When Han arose, they established two ranks. In the late years of Gaozu, those not of the Liu clan who became kings, or those without merit whom the emperor did not establish as marquises, were to be executed by all under heaven. Gaozu's sons and younger brothers of the same clan who became kings numbered nine states, although Changsha alone was of a different surname, while meritorious officials who became marquises numbered more than one hundred. From Yanmen and Taiyuan eastward to Liaoyang was the Yan and Dai states; South of Changshan, turning left at Mount Taihang, crossing the Yellow River and Ji, eastward from A and Zhen to the sea, was the Qi and Zhao states; From Chen westward, south to Jiuyi, eastward along the Yangtze, Huai, Gu, and Si rivers to Kuaiji, was the Liang, Chu, Huainan, and Changsha states: all bordering externally on the Xiongnu and Yue. The inner lands north of the mountains eastward encompassed all the feudal lords' territories, the largest comprising five or six commanderies, connecting dozens of cities, establishing the hundred officials and palaces, rivaling the Son of Heaven. Han alone possessed Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, and Nanyang commanderies, from Jiangling westward to Shu, north from Yunzhong to Longxi, together with the Interior Commandery making fifteen commanderies, while princesses and marquises had their fiefs scattered among them. Why was this? When the realm was first pacified, flesh and blood of the same surname were few, therefore they extensively strengthened collateral branches to soothe and control the four seas, using them to support and protect the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 漢定百年之閒，親屬益疏，諸侯或驕奢，忕邪臣計謀為淫亂，大者叛逆，小者不軌于法，以危其命，殞身亡國。

translations.text: Within a century of Han's establishment, relatives grew more distant, feudal lords became arrogant and extravagant, evil ministers plotted licentious disorder, the great ones rebelled, the small ones violated the law, endangering their lives, losing their persons and states.

sentences.zh: 天子觀於上古，然後加惠，使諸侯得推恩分子弟國邑，故齊分為七，趙分為六，梁分為五，淮南分三，及天子支庶子為王，王子支庶為侯，百有餘焉。

translations.text: The Son of Heaven observed the ancient past, then bestowed favor, allowing the feudal lords to extend grace by dividing territories to younger brothers and sons, therefore Qi was divided into seven, Zhao into six, Liang into five, Huainan into three, and the Son of Heaven's collateral branches became kings, kings' collateral branches became marquises, numbering more than one hundred.

sentences.zh: 吳楚時，前后諸侯或以適削地，是以燕、代無北邊郡，吳、淮南、長沙無南邊郡，齊、趙、梁、楚支郡名山陂海咸納於漢。

translations.text: During the Wu and Chu period, previous and later feudal lords sometimes had their territories reduced for offenses, therefore Yan and Dai had no northern border commanderies, Wu, Huainan, and Changsha had no southern border commanderies, Qi, Zhao, Liang, and Chu's branch commanderies and famous mountains and seacoasts all reverted to Han.

sentences.zh: 諸侯稍微，大國不過十餘城，小侯不過數十里，上足以奉貢職，下足以供養祭祀，以蕃輔京師。

translations.text: The feudal lords gradually weakened, large states had no more than ten or so cities, small marquises no more than several dozen li, above sufficient to pay tribute and duties, below sufficient to provide for sacrifices, to protect and assist the capital.

sentences.zh: 而漢郡八九十，形錯諸侯閒，犬牙相臨，秉其阸塞地利，彊本干，弱枝葉之勢，尊卑明而萬事各得其所矣。

translations.text: While Han had eighty or ninety commanderies, interspersed among the feudal lords like dog teeth interlocking, holding the strategic positions and geographical advantages, strengthening the root and trunk, weakening the branches and leaves - thus hierarchy was clear and all matters found their proper place.

Within a century of Han's establishment, relatives grew more distant, feudal lords became arrogant and extravagant, evil ministers plotted licentious disorder, the great ones rebelled, the small ones violated the law, endangering their lives, losing their persons and states. The Son of Heaven observed the ancient past, then bestowed favor, allowing the feudal lords to extend grace by dividing territories to younger brothers and sons, therefore Qi was divided into seven, Zhao into six, Liang into five, Huainan into three, and the Son of Heaven's collateral branches became kings, kings' collateral branches became marquises, numbering more than one hundred. During the Wu and Chu period, previous and later feudal lords sometimes had their territories reduced for offenses, therefore Yan and Dai had no northern border commanderies, Wu, Huainan, and Changsha had no southern border commanderies, Qi, Zhao, Liang, and Chu's branch commanderies and famous mountains and seacoasts all reverted to Han. The feudal lords gradually weakened, large states had no more than ten or so cities, small marquises no more than several dozen li, above sufficient to pay tribute and duties, below sufficient to provide for sacrifices, to protect and assist the capital. While Han had eighty or ninety commanderies, interspersed among the feudal lords like dog teeth interlocking, holding the strategic positions and geographical advantages, strengthening the root and trunk, weakening the branches and leaves - thus hierarchy was clear and all matters found their proper place.

sentences.zh: 臣遷謹記高祖以來至太初諸侯，譜其下益損之時，令時世得覽。

translations.text: I, the minister Qian, have carefully recorded the feudal lords from Gaozu to the Taichu period, noting when their territories were increased or diminished, so that the present age may view them.

sentences.zh: 形勢雖彊，要之以仁義為本。

translations.text: Though their position was strong, they took benevolence and righteousness as their foundation.

I, the minister Qian, have carefully recorded the feudal lords from Gaozu to the Taichu period, noting when their territories were increased or diminished, so that the present age may view them. Though their position was strong, they took benevolence and righteousness as their foundation.

cells.content: 十一月，初王韓信元年。都馬邑。
cells.translation: Eleventh month, initially king Han Xin first year. Capital at Maiyi.
Initially king Xin first year. Former Chancellor.

cells.content: 十月乙丑，初王英布元年。
cells.translation: Tenth month bingchou, initially king Ying Bu first year.
Initially king Zhang Er first year. Died.

cells.content: 齊王信徙為楚王元年。反，廢。
cells.translation: Qi king Xin transferred to Chu king first year. Rebelled, deposed.

cells.content: 後九月壬子，初王盧綰元年。
cells.translation: Nine months later renyin, initially king Lu Wan first year.
King Ao first year. Ao, Er's son.
Initially king Peng Yue first year
Fourth year. Surrendered to Xiongnu, state abolished as commandery.

cells.content: 二月乙未，初王文王吳芮元年。薨。
cells.translation: Second month bingwei, initially king Wen Wang Wu Rui first year. Died.

cells.content: 正月丙午，初王交元年。交，高祖弟。
cells.translation: First month bingwu, initially king Jiao first year. Jiao, Gaozu's younger brother.

cells.content: 正月甲子，初王悼惠王肥元年。肥，高祖子。
cells.translation: First month jiashu, initially king Daohui Wang Fei first year. Fei, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 正月丙午，初王劉賈元年。
cells.translation: First month bingwu, initially king Liu Jia first year.

cells.content: 初王隱王如意元年。如意，高祖子。
cells.translation: Initially king Yin Wang Ruyi first year. Ruyi, Gaozu's son.
Seventh year. Came to court. Rebelled, executed.
Sixth year. Came to court. Rebelled, executed.
Again established Dai, capital at Zhongdu.

cells.content: 六。為英布所殺，國除為郡。
cells.translation: Sixth year. Killed by Ying Bu, state abolished as commandery.

cells.content: 十二月庚午，厲王長元年。長，高祖子。
cells.translation: Twelfth month gengwu, Li Wang Chang first year. Chang, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 二月丙午，初王恢元年。恢，高祖子。
cells.translation: Second month bingwu, initially king Hui first year. Hui, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 三月丙寅，初王友元年。友，高祖子。
cells.translation: Third month bingyin, initially king You first year. You, Gaozu's son.
First month bingzi initially king first year.

cells.content: 更為吳國。十月辛丑，初王濞元年。濞，高祖兄仲子，故沛侯。
cells.translation: Changed to Wu state. Tenth month xinchou, initially king Pi first year. Pi, Gaozu's elder brother Zhong's son, former Pei marquess.

cells.content: 二月甲午，初王靈王建元年。建，高祖子。
cells.translation: Second month jiashu, initially king Ling Wang Jian first year. Jian, Gaozu's son.

cells.content: 淮陽王徙於趙，名友，元年。是為幽王。
cells.translation: Huaiyang king transferred to Zhao, named You, first year. This is King You.

cells.content: 四月初王張偃元年。偃，高后外孫，故趙王敖子。
四月辛卯，哀王不疑元年。薨。
四月辛卯，呂王台元年。薨。
四月辛卯，初王懷王強元年。強，惠帝子。
七月癸巳，初王義元年。哀王弟。義，孝惠子，故襄城侯，立為帝。
十一月癸亥，王呂嘉元年。嘉，肅王子。
五月丙辰，初王朝元年。朝，惠帝子，故軹侯。
嘉廢。七月丙辰，呂產元年。產，肅王弟，故洨侯。
初王武元年。武，孝惠帝子，故壺關侯。
呂產徙王梁。二月丁巳，王太元年。惠帝子。
十月辛丑，初王呂通元年。肅王子，故東平侯。九月誅，國除。
初王呂祿元年。呂后兄子，胡陵侯。誅，國除。
十月庚戌，琅邪王澤徙燕元年。是為敬王。
十月庚戌，趙王遂元年。幽王子。
二月乙卯景王章元年。章，悼惠王子，故朱虛侯。
二月乙卯，王興居元年。興居，悼惠王子，故東牟侯。
二月乙卯，初王文王辟強元年。辟強，趙幽王子。
二月乙卯，初王參元年。參，文帝子。
二月乙卯，初王懷王勝元年。勝，文帝子。
二月乙卯，初王武元年。武，文帝子。
三。太原王參更號為代王三年，實居太原，是為孝王。
二十三。王無道，遷蜀，死雍，為郡。
十一。淮陽王武徙梁年，是為孝王。
哀王福元年。薨，無後，國除為郡。
四月丙寅，王勃元年。淮南厲王子，故安陽侯。
四月丙寅，孝王將閭元年。齊悼惠王子，故陽虛侯。
淮南王喜徙城陽十三年。
四月丙寅，初王志元年。齊悼惠王子，故安都侯。
四月丙寅，初王辟光元年。齊悼惠王子，故扐侯。
四月丙寅，初王賢元年。齊悼惠王子，故武城侯。
四月丙寅，初王卬元年。齊悼惠王子，故平昌侯。
四月丙寅，初王雄渠元年。齊悼惠王子，故白石侯。
四月丙寅，王安元年。淮南厲王子，故阜陵侯。
四月丙寅，王賜元年。淮南厲王子，故陽周侯。
二十一。來朝。薨，無後，國除。
三月甲寅，初王獻王德元年。景帝子。
三月甲寅，王彭祖元年。景帝子。
三月甲寅，初王閼于元年。景帝子。
三月甲寅，初王非元年。景帝子。
三月甲寅，初王餘元年，景帝子。
三月甲寅，定王發元年。景帝子。
六月乙亥淮陽王徙魯元年。是為恭王。
十一。反，誅。濟北王志徙菑川十一年。是為懿王。
十一。反，誅。六月乙亥，于王端元年。景帝子。
六月乙亥，靖王勝元年。景帝子。
文王禮元年。元王子，故平陸侯。
十二。徙濟北。廬江王賜徙衡山元年。
衡山王勃徙濟北十二年。是為貞王。
四月己巳，初王元年。是為孝武帝。
初置江都。六月乙亥，汝南王非為江都王元年。是為易王。
廣川王彭祖徙趙四年。是為敬肅王。
十一月乙丑，初王閔王榮元年。景帝太子，廢。
四月乙巳，初王康王寄元年。景帝子。
四月乙巳，惠王越元年。景帝子。
三月丁巳，哀王乘元年。景帝子。
四。坐侵廟壖垣為宮，自殺。國除為南郡。
四月丁巳，初王憲王舜元年。孝景子。
五月丙戌，初王明元年。梁孝王子。
五月丙戌，初王彭離元年。梁孝王子。
五月丙戌，初王定元年。梁孝王子。
五月丙戌，初王不識元年。梁孝王子。
二十四。坐禽獸行自殺。國除為郡。
四十一。安有罪，削國二縣。
七。反，自殺，國除為廣陵郡。
置六安國，以故陳為都。七月丙子。初王恭王慶元年。膠東王子。
四月乙巳，初王懷王閎元年。武帝子。
四月乙巳，初王胥元年。武帝子。
四月乙巳，初王剌王旦元年。武帝子。
二十九。剽攻殺人，遷上庸，國為大河郡。
思王商元年。商，常山憲王子。
二十。代王義徙清河年。是為剛王。
更為真定國。頃王平元年。常山憲王子。
哀王安世元年。即戴王賀元年。安世子。
